easy.question: My classmates stayed back ____ lunchtime to discuss their school project.
At the concert last week, the students ___ so excited that they could not stop talking.
You ____ so kind when you helped the teacher carry the heavy books to the classroom.

Yesterday, we ___ some books from the bookshop before going to tuition.
While you ____ in the kitchen, i heard a knock on the door.
___ girl on the swing has short hair.
She likes waffles ___ not pancakes.

My friend needed ___ help with her work, so i stayed back to assist her.
The young boy waited by the door ___ a long time.
Many buildings ___ destroyed by the tsunami last year.
Jun Wei __  unwell, so he is absent from school today.
Mrs Tan ____ the rules of the test now.
15. in 2019, Singapore ____ wearing masks compulsory due to COVID-19.
Amy _____ the piano when the doorbell rang.
The Lim family visited ____ local attractions in Singapore during the holidays, instead of travelling overseas.
My father said : ' Use ____ two dollar note to buy bread from the store nearby.
He was respected _____ he did his work efficiently
Our teacher gave us ___ advice on how to do better in exams.
Distribute these chocolates among ______
One week ago, We ____ the museum before it closed for renovations.
Last Sunday, i ____ happy to meet my favorite celebrity at the mall.
___ books stacked in the corner are dusty.
Aunt Mary is my neighbour that lives ___ units away from me.

medium.question: The ____ took out their phones to record the fight in the supermarket.
The ____ child refused to listen to the teachers and got into trouble again.
The students ___ their books into their bags in a hurry before leaving.
All the houses were destroyed by the ___ earthquake.

10. We ____ our conflict by flipping a coin.
Many passers-by were ____ to the cyclist who had fallen and did not help him.
The ___ cars were recalled by the company for having many problems.
I am _____ from all the running i did today.
All my friends claimed that the test was ______, and they could not complete many questions.
Wearing masks was ____ during the pandemic. Not wearing one had severe consequences.
You can conserve the environment by _______ plastic bottles.
Plants play a _____ role in maintaining Earth's oxygen level.
The bread tasted _____.
His work was not up to _____.
I am ____ for the upcoming football match.
Our project _____ is approaching soon. We have to submit all our work before then.
The mouse ____ into the hole.
She felt ____ that she received the award.
The weather is ____ ,with heavy rain today.
I will _____ the present from the post office tomorrow.

hard.question: What is the term for a word that is spelled the same way forwards and backwards?
In the sentence 'The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog,' what is the verb?
Which figure of speech involves an exaggerated statement or claim not meant to be taken literally?
Identify the word in the sentence: 'She diligently studied for her exams.'
What is the term for a word that imitates the sound it represents, such as 'buzz' or 'meow'?
Which of the following sentences uses the subjunctive mood correctly?
answers: If he was here, he would help.
I wish she was coming to the party.
If I were you, I would go.
She will come if it was sunny.

hard.question: What is the correct plural form of 'datum'?
In the sentence 'The painting is exquisite,' what part of speech is 'exquisite'?
Which word is a synonym for 'ubiquitous'?
Identify the correct form of the verb in the sentence: 'She has been singing beautifully.'
What is the term for a group of words that expresses a complete thought and contains a subject and a predicate?
In the sentence 'The stormy sea roared loudly,' what is the adverb?
Which literary device involves giving human characteristics to non-human entities?
What is the term for a word that sounds like the noise it describes, such as 'hiss' or 'clang'?
Identify the figure of speech in the sentence: 'The world is a stage, and we are all actors.'
What is the term for a word that sounds like another word, such as 'bare' and 'bear'?
Identify the subject in the sentence: 'The diligent student aced the exam.'
Which of the following sentences uses an oxymoron?
answers: The bright darkness consumed the room.
She spoke in a clear and concise manner.
The cat lazily stretched in the warm sunlight.
He quickly ran to catch the bus.

hard.question: What is the term for a statement that contradicts itself and yet might be true?
Identify the word in the sentence: 'The singing birds filled the air with melody.'
Which word is an antonym for 'loquacious'?
What is the term for a phrase that consists of words with opposite meanings, such as 'bittersweet'?
Identify the conjunction in the following sentence: 'I wanted to go to the store, but I had no money.'
What is the term for a word or phrase that reads the same way forwards and backwards, like 'racecar' or 'madam'?
Identify the word in the sentence: 'The teacher commended the hardworking students.'
